channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ESPN hopes to reach more casual sports fans with Disney+ integration
item.description: Disney debuted an ESPN tab on Disney+ on Wednesday for ESPN+ subscribers and will make about 100 live games available on Disney+ to non-subscribers.

item.title: European markets rise as investors brace for French no-confidence vote
item.description: European stocks were higher Wednesday with regional market attention focused on an upcoming no-confidence vote in France's National Assembly.

item.title: This investment is cheaper and better than mutual funds
item.description: Opponents shouldn‚Äôt block 403(b)s from purchasing collective investment trusts

item.title: Amazon sued by DC attorney general for allegedly excluding neighborhoods from Prime delivery
item.description: Amazon's actions caused more than 48,000 Prime members to get slower delivery than the rest of the capital city, Attorney General Brian Schwalb claimed.

item.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson fatally shot in New York
item.description: UnitedHealth Group canceled its investor day after reports that the CEO of its insurer unit, Brian Thompson, was fatally shot in Manhattan.

item.title: The Social Security Fairness Act is incredibly irresponsible
item.description: Instead of being fair, this legislation will lead to harsher and faster automatic benefit cuts for most of us.

item.title: Private payrolls grew by 146,000 in November, less than expected, ADP says
item.description: Companies added 146,000 jobs on the month, below the downwardly revised 184,000 in October and less than the Dow Jones estimate for 163,000.

item.title: Dow rises more than 200 points, led by Salesforce surge: Live updates
item.description: Stocks rose Wednesday as Salesforce and Marvell Technology led tech shares higher on the back of strong quarterly earnings.

item.title: Slurpee and an IPO, please: 7-Eleven parent Seven & I may list North American business, report says
item.description: Japan‚Äôs Seven & I Holdings Co., fending off a takeover bid, may list its North American 7-Eleven convenience stores in an initial public offering as part of a management-led takeover bid, according to a published report.

item.title: Florida woman who led a nearly $200 million Ponzi scheme sentenced to 20 years in prison
item.description: Federal prosecutors said Florida resident Johanna Garcia led a Ponzi scheme that raised nearly $200 million and lost investors nearly $90 million.

item.title: Amazon sued by DC attorney general for allegedly excluding neighborhoods from Prime delivery
item.description: Amazon's actions caused more than 48,000 Prime members to get slower delivery than the rest of the capital city, Attorney General Brian Schwalb claimed.

item.title: UnitedHealthcare executive Brian Thompson shot and killed in New York City, according to reports
item.description: Thompson headed up the health-benefits unit of UnitedHealth Group.

item.title: Trump considers replacing Pete Hegseth, his embattled secretary of defense pick, with Ron DeSantis
item.description: Trump's choice of Hegseth is now in jeopardy because of allegations of drinking and reports about his treatment of women.

item.title: South Korea's short-lived martial law declaration rattled markets. Here's what's next for stocks
item.description: An extraordinary political drama in South Korea is likely to compound an already gloomy outlook for Asia's fourth-largest economy, analysts say.
